nodes.bodyText:
Should we be tracking this by AggregatorIndexAndEpoch?:
The aggregate is the first valid aggregate received for the aggregator with index aggregate_and_proof.aggregator_index for the epoch aggregate.data.target.epoch.

I think this will let us short-circuit earlier in some cases.

I don't think we're hitting this constraint:
The aggregate attestation defined by hash_tree_root(aggregate) has not already been seen (via aggregate gossip, within a verified block, or through the creation of an equivalent aggregate locally).
Shouldn't we return SAVED_FOR_FUTURE here if the state isn't available?
